result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glen Dale Lamorie

records.addlTxt:
NO VIOLENT OR ABUSIVE CONTACT  M.M.W.  DOB: 06/15/1979

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:06 AM Defendant Glen Dale Lamorie in court.  Attorney Kevin Van Ert appeared by video for Glen Dale Lamorie.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.  Through Counsel DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing, and indicates DEF will be seeking treatment.    DEF may appear by zoom, if in treatment.   State indicates victim would like to address the court regarding bond modification. Court addresses the victim, Victim responds.   State makes statement regarding bond.  Court makes statement.  Court grants bond request.    Bond Conditions amended.   SIBS $2500  NO VIOLENT OR ABUSIVE CONTACT  M.M.W.  DOB: 06/15/1979

Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.

11:08 AM DE Glen Lamorie in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) in person. Kenneth Sortedahl  appeared in by video for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak No objection.  Court sets based on recommendation and the probable cause statement. Court sets bond.
